result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry D Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 

Court orders that the firearm is to be forfeited.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry D Hart

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 9:04 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Larry D Hart in court.  
Court has a colloquy with the defendant waiving his right to an attorney.
Court takes a recess so the defendant can complete paperwork.
Court recalls the case at 9:37 a.m.  Same appearances.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
45 DAYS JAIL
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent

Court orders that the Firearm is to be forfeited.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

10:01 AM Defendant Larry D Hart in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
